page.title: 03DAIRYING-the main enterprise
page.content: Dairying is the predominant farming enterprise-milk production for both the liquid and process industries.Of the 8 dairy herds,all but one are commercial friesian herds with an average herd size of 100 head; the other being a small herd of jersey cows producing milk for processing, on farm, jersey cream which is sold at the farm gate and through local retail outlets. On all units heifers are reared for dairy herd replacement. Grass,as well as being grazed,is conserved as silage and hay.Generally, herds are winterhoused and fed on a mix of silage, hay and purchased concentrate feeds, although 16 hectares of kale are grown on one unit for winter feed.
